subject: Re: [junit] Please suggest a book on Junit for beginners
msgSnippet: ... Thanks for the compliment, I think. I showed this to my wife and said, This is the best compliment I ve ever received, except for getting the title
messageBody:
jason r tibbetts wrote:

>
> FWIW, I wrote a "So you'd like to..." page on Amazon that describes the
> books that I used to learn unit testing. In a nutshell, I started with
> the Pragmatic Programmers' /Pragmatic Unit Testing/, moved up to /Unit
> Testing in Java/ (which wasn't so great), and found nerdvana in J.B.
> Rainsberger's /JUnit in Action/.

Thanks for the compliment, I think. I showed this to my wife and said,
"This is the best compliment I've ever received, except for getting the
title right." She replied, "Are you sure he means your book and not
Vincent's?"
--
J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger :: http://www.jbrains.info
Your guide to software craftsmanship
JUnit Recipes: Practical Methods for Programmer Testing
2005 Gordon Pask Award for contribution Agile Software Practice
